content:
toge opened issue #4968:

The 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 releases are for different architectures.

I would like to have the same version for each architecture.
Is there any plan to release binaries for all architectures in each release?

bjorn3 commented on issue #4968:

An API ratelimit was exceeded during the publish, causing some artifacts to be missing from the release: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/actions/runs/3130842242

deadprogram commented on issue #4968:

Unfortunately this has resulted in the standard install script being broken on Linux machines.

toge commented on issue #4968:

@bjorn3
Thank you for comment.
Will any other binaries be provided for 1.0.1 after the rate limit is removed?

bjorn3 commented on issue #4968:

I think someone would need to rerun the publish workflow or something to add the extra binaries to the release. @alexcrichton?

alexcrichton commented on issue #4968:

Yes this was just an infrastructure hiccup, thanks for the report though! I've almost completed the "surgery" and everything should be there now except for the macOS artifacts which are tracked here. I will watch that and make sure it completes, otherwise though I'm going to close this since this should be otherwise fixed.

alexcrichton closed issue #4968:

The 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 releases are for different architectures.

I would like to have the same version for each architecture.
Is there any plan to release binaries for all architectures in each release?
